newsitem.title: USA: WMS Industries accrues for suit.
newsitem.headline: WMS Industries accrues for suit.

text.p: WMS Industries Inc said Thursday it had decided to accrue for $29 million in potential damages and take provisions and adjustments of another $33 million for a patent suit brought by International Game Technology.

The U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Illinois has already ruled IGT is entitled to treble damages under the action, and WMS said it expects IGT to be awarded the full amount of its claimed damages, which would amount to about $29 million after trebling.
WMS said it had decided to accrue the damages even though it has appealed the decision to a federal appeals court. reversals occur in only a minority of the patent cases reviewed, it said.
It said it had also made provisions and adjustments totalling $32.9 million for realization of receivables and inventory and legal fees, all related to the court decision.
Offsetting those actions in the company's most recent quarter was a $79.2 million gain from the initial public offering of part of WMS's Midway Games Inc unit.

After taxes, the unusual items added $10.4 million, or $0.43 per share, to company income, putting second quarter net income at $21.5 million, or $0.89 per share, versus $8.9 million, or $0.37 per share, a year ago.
The year-ago results included discontinued operations income of $1.0 million, or $0.04 per share.
